page.title: 16PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: The library is a feature of West Calder and sits at the edge of the village.If you are in need of any information you can get it from the library.It opened on the 30th July 1903 and now has approximately 10000 books.Information and other books can be brought in from other libraries if needed.Limefield House was once the home of James Young but is now an old folks home.Another feature of the village is the co-op's clock.It was laid on the 10th of June 1884 by Sir William Maxwell then the president of the S.C.W.S Ltd.The clock was on the old co-op and was removed when it was knocked down.In 1983 it was put up on its own and now stands in the village square.The event of its original erection was talked of for many years.
